channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Cuts Ties With Marjorie Taylor Greene, Calling Her ‘Wacky’
item.description: The rupture exposed the divides within President Trump’s MAGA base over the Epstein files and more.

item.title: Trump Escalates Pressure on Venezuela, but Endgame Is Unclear
item.description: President Trump’s aides have provided conflicting accounts of what, exactly, they are seeking to achieve, as America’s largest aircraft carrier heads ...

item.title: Trump Administration Lifts Some Food Tariffs in Effort to Ease Prices
item.description: It is walking back levies on imports including beef and coffee in what critics say is an admission that tariffs raised prices in the first place.

item.title: Justice Department to Investigate Epstein Ties, but Not to Trump

item.title: Judge Orders Trump Not to Threaten University of California’s Funding
item.description: An extraordinary rebuke to the federal government’s campaign against elite schools, the ruling could upend settlement talks with the university system...

item.title: Fears Fuel Tanker Was Seized by Iran in Strait of Hormuz
item.description: The ship, which was flying a Marshall Islands flag, was bound for Singapore when it lost contact with its managers and appeared headed toward Iran.

item.title: Modi’s Coalition Sweeps Indian State Election Criticized Over Voter Rolls

item.title: As Trump Targets Antifa in U.S., Rubio Labels European Groups as Terrorists

item.title: While Asian Immigrants Work, Burglars Target Their Homes
item.description: Some law enforcement officials say they think organized crime rings from South America, in particular from Colombia, are responsible for the crime spr...

item.title: 43-year-old democratic socialist who’s never held elected office unseats Seattle Mayor in another win for affordability politics
item.description: Katie Wilson is a renter herself, of a one-bedroom apartment in Capitol Hill, and says it shaped her understanding of Seattle’s affordability crisis.

item.title: Verizon will cut about 15,000 jobs after new CEO says ‘cost reductions will be a way of life for us here’
item.description: CEO Daniel Schulman, who formerly headed PayPal’s global transformation and Virgin Mobile’s $483 million sale, looks to turn around the telecoms giant...

item.title: White House prepares to host Saudi Crown Prince in an arrival ceremony just short of an official state visit
item.description: His visit is billed as an official working visit because Prince Mohammed is not technically a head of state, the official said.

item.title: Cincinnati Reds great Barry Larkin brings baseball to the Middle East, with camels carting in relief pitchers from the bullpen
item.description: “Thirty years in the game and I've never seen a camel in the bullpen,” Karachi Monarchs pitching coach Frank Gonzales said. “I kind of like it though....

item.title: Trump responds to appearance in new Epstein emails by pushing DOJ probe of Clinton, Larry Summers, Reid Hoffman
item.description: Across messages with lawyers, acquaintances, reporters, academics, and political figures, Epstein invoked Trump constantly.

item.title: At U.N. Security Council, Russia Counters Trump Gaza Plan With Its Own
item.description: The Trump administration wants the Security Council to adopt a resolution that has the 20-point U.S. plan annexed, effectively making it international...
